page.title: 07 A RESIDENTIAL HOME
page.content: Gilbert Sutcliffe Court is a residential home for old people.A lady warden looks after the old people.They have a lounge where the old people can sit and talk,play games like bingo or dominoes,or use the small library. The lady showed us two lifts and some stairs.The lifts are for the people who cannot use the stairs easily or who are in wheelchairs .There is a guest room for visitors. Any rubbish goes down a shute so dustbins do not need emptying. There is a place for ladies and gentlemens hairdressing and this doubles up with the T.V.room. The oldest lady in the home was 92 and there are 32 flats all with old people in them.When old people are ill they pull a cord which sets a alarm bell off in the wardens office and outside there room.There is always someone to help them if they are ill.
